title: Google extends Chromebook support from 8 years to 10 after heightened backlash
description: Automatic Chromebook expiration dates are "fundamentally flawed," critics say.

title: Unity shuts two offices, citing threats after controversial pricing changes
description: San Francisco HQ and Austin office closed through Friday, CEO town hall delayed.

title: The Pixel Tablet is actually just a few spare parts in a half-empty body
description: Why is this $500 tablet full of so much empty space?

title: Google hid evidence by training workers to avoid words monopolists use, DOJ says
description: "We don't 'lock up'... our customers," and "we do not 'leverage' anything."

title: X agrees to negotiate with laid-off employees after 2,000 arbitration demands
description: "Twitter wants to mediate with us... to settle all claims," lawyer's memo says.

title: More countries are concerned about the iPhone 12’s EMF radiation profile
description: France is pulling the mostly off-the-market phone and considering a recall.

title: Autopsy of a star reveals what was eviscerated by a monster black hole
description: From the interior of a star to the accretion disk of a black hole.

title: Black Manta is out for revenge in trailer for Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom
description: "I don't know what lies ahead. But we can't leave our children a world without hope."

title: This EV smashed the world record for distance on a single charge
description: At 103 miles/kWh, the car is 25 times more efficient than any EV on sale.

title: Contrary to rumors, the iPhone 15 has a standard, by-the-book USB-C port
description: Apple already sells standard USB-C devices, and the iPhone is no different.

title: A phone call to helpdesk was likely all it took to hack MGM
description: Slot machines and hotel room key cards stopped working at MGM casinos on the Strip.

title: HP’s $5,000 Spectre Foldable PC has a lot to prove
description: 17-inch bendy OLED with an i7, 12th-gen chip will be available at the end of October.
